column4: Auction houses ditch 'art girls' as sex fails to sell
column5: LONDON (Thomson Reuters Foundation) - Two of the world's oldest auction houses have scrapped the practice of only using only female staff to pose beside their artworks  in the latest indication that sexism doesn't sell.

column4: Southwest Airlines bookings drop after fatal engine blowout
column5: NEW YORK Southwest Airlines  on Monday said it now expects its second-quarter unit revenue to decrease by about 3 percent from the year prior  primarily driven by lower bookings in the wake of a fatal engine blowout in April.

column4: Southwest Airlines bookings drop after fatal engine blowout
column5: NEW YORK  June 4 Southwest Airlines on Monday said it now expects its second-quarter unit revenue to decrease by about 3 percent from the year prior  primarily driven by lower bookings in the wake of a fatal engine blowout in April.

column4: Former State Street executive faces U.S. fraud trial
column5: BOSTON A former executive at State Street Corp  went on trial on Monday on U.S. charges that he participated in a scheme to defraud the bank's clients by charging them secret commissions on billions of dollars in trades.

column4: UPDATE 1-Former State Street executive faces U.S. fraud trial
column5: BOSTON  June 4 A former executive at State Street Corp went on trial on Monday on U.S. charges that he participated in a scheme to defraud the bank's clients by charging them secret commissions on billions of dollars in trades.

column4: Former State Street executive faces U.S. fraud trial
column5: BOSTON  June 4 A former executive at State Street Corp is set to face trial on U.S. charges that he participated in a scheme to defraud the bank's clients by charging them secret commissions on billions of dollars in trades.

column4: BHP process to unload U.S. shale operations could take until 2019
column5: NEW YORK The planned exit of BHP Billiton Ltd from its U.S. shale business has drawn oil companies and private equity firms into a competition that may have no clear winner until late this year or early next year  according to people familiar with the negotiations.

column4: BHP process to unload U.S. shale operations could take until 2019
column5: NEW YORK  June 4 The planned exit of BHP Billiton Ltd  from its U.S. shale business has drawn oil companies and private equity firms into a competition that may have no clear winner until late this year or early next year  according to people familiar with the negotiations.

column4: France's Total plans growth along U.S. Gulf Coast in petrochemicals
column5: PORT ARTHUR  Texas Adding petrochemical plants is how French energy conglomerate Total SA plans to expand along the U.S. Gulf Coast in the coming years  a company executive said on Monday.

column4: Twitter Inc to join the S&P 500  replacing Monsanto
column5: Twitter Inc. will replace Monsanto in the S&P 500  S&P Dow Jones Indices said on Monday.

column4: Walmart sells majority of Brazil unit  takes $4.5 billion charge
column5: NEW YORK/SAO PAULO Walmart Inc  said on Monday that it has sold an 80 percent stake in its Brazilian operations to private equity firm Advent International  exiting an underperforming business in its third major international deal since April.

column4: UPDATE 4-Walmart sells majority of Brazil unit  takes $4.5 bln charge
column5: NEW YORK/SAO PAULO  June 4 Walmart Inc said on Monday that it has sold an 80 percent stake in its Brazilian operations to private equity firm Advent International  exiting an underperforming business in its third major international deal since April.

column4: Advent International picks up majority stake in Walmart Brazil
column5: NEW YORK  June 4 Walmart Inc said on Monday private equity firm Advent International will pick up a 80 percent stake in Walmart Brazil and the retailer will retain the remaining 20 percent.
